DataElement.preferredName: First-Line Therapy Initial Diagnosis Administered Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on the receiving of the preferred standard treatment occurring at the beginning of the presence of disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the receiving of the preferred standard treatment occurring at the beginning of the presence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.

Concepts.definition: The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.

Property.preferredDefinition: occurring at the beginning.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on the receiving of the preferred standard treatment occurring at the beginning of the presence of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.: Treatment to boost or restore the ability of the immune system to fight cancer, infections, and other diseases. Also used to lessen certain side effects that may be caused by some cancer treatments. Agents used in immunotherapy include monoclonal antibodies, growth factors, and vaccines. These agents may also have a direct antitumor effect.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relatively undifferentiated cells of the same lineage (family type) that retain the ability to divide throughout postnatal life to reproduce themselves and to give rise to other more specialized types of cells to take the place of those that die or are lost. (MeSH): Used with organs, tissues, or cells for transplantation from one site to another within the same subject, or from one subject to another of the same species or different species.

Concepts.definition: An unspecialized cell that has the capacity for reproduction through cell division and can be induced to differentiate into a tissue or organ specific cell.
Used with organs, tissues, or cells for transplantation from one site to another within the same subject, or from one subject to another of the same species or different species.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

Concepts.definition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
